comment.author: 76204898@N00
comment._content: This picture labels the store a dairy: "The 'Maggi' dairy sacked at the beginning of the war, Rue Richier, Paris, August 1914." Upon a quick search, I found this eyewitness report (from New Zealand, of all places), which describes Maggi as a brand of milk and consomme, discovered to be a German product sold by a German firm. Very interesting report of the first reaction to the mobilization, the Appenrodt tea room which we just discussed here also gets a mention.
